result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota J. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all fines/costs/fees.

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dakota J. Krueger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:30 a.m. Defendant Dakota J. Krueger in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Laska/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
WHS/POP - 6 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Fine - $579 (including costs)
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all fines/costs/fees.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 11:40 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:30 p.m. Defendant Dakota J. Krueger in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant as to non-appearance. Court quashes warrant. Attorney Laska has obtained pre-trial date. Defendant states he forgot about court appearance and works non-stop. Bail continued. Adj. 1:32
Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2016 at 11:30 am.

1:50 p.m. Defendant not present. Attorney Cana G Laska in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Laska anticipated defendant's appearance today. State requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 1:51 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

2:59 p.m. Defendant Dakota J. Krueger in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan for Cana G Laska.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Laska has obtained June 21, 2016 at 1:30 date for pre-trial conference.
Bail continued. Adj. 3:00 p.m.
Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:37 p.m. Defendant Dakota J. Krueger in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:39 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
